name: No-Knead Pizza Dough
author: LauraF
summary: I've tried several no-knead bread recipes, and wanted to see if the approach would work for pizza. Happily, it does. Start the dough the night before and let it do its thing until you're ready to shape, top, and bake! If not using right away, wrap well in plastic wrap and refrigerate for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 1 month.
ingredients: 1 ½ tablespoons cornmeal, or as needed
directions: Combine bread flour, all-purpose flour, rye flour, and salt in a large bowl
Add water, olive oil, and yeast
Mix with a wooden spoon until a sticky, shaggy dough forms
Mix in 1 tablespoon water if dough appears very dry
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let dough rise at room temperature until more than doubled, about 18 hours
Scrape dough carefully onto a floured work surface
Fold the left edge of one piece of dough into the center
Repeat with the top, right, and bottom edges
Turn dough over so the seam faces down; top should be relatively smooth and round
Repeat with the second piece of dough
Preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C)
Line a heavy-duty baking sheet with parchment paper
Gently flatten the balls of dough and stretch into rustic rounds or ovals
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes
